article_title: How the Fed Saved the Economy
article_text: For the first time in nearly a decade, the Federal Reserve is considering raising its target interest rate, which would end a long period of near-zero rates. Like the cessation of large-scale asset purchases in October 2014, that action will be an important milestone in the unwinding of extraordinary monetary policies, adopted during my tenure as Fed chairman, to help the economy recover from a historic financial crisis. As such, it’s a good time to evaluate the results of those measures, and to consider where policy makers...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, former Federal Reserve Chairman Ben Bernanke writes that full employment without inflation is in sight. The central bank did its job. What about everyone else?
twitter.title: How the Fed Saved the Economy

article_summary:
As such, it’s a good time to evaluate the results of those measures, and to consider where policy makers...
Like the cessation of large-scale asset purchases in October 2014, that action will be an important milestone in the unwinding of extraordinary monetary policies, adopted during my tenure as Fed chairman, to help the economy recover from a historic financial crisis.
For the first time in nearly a decade, the Federal Reserve is considering raising its target interest rate, which would end a long period of near-zero rates.
